snippet: Forced to put four model railroads up for sale, including a set that once attracted millions in Manhattan, Clarke and Barbara Dunham now hope to raise enough to cover the purchase.
abstract: Clarke and Barbara Dunham, creators of model railroad the Station, hope to raise enough money to cover purchase price of four train exhibits, which they were forced to sell at auction after exhibit failed to turn profit; couple made modest bids to buy back trains, which went unchallenged, but must settle tab before Dec 20 deadline; the Station is part of Railroads on Parade, tourist attraction in Pottersville, NY.
lead_paragraph: Forced to put four model railroads up for sale, including a set that once attracted millions in Manhattan, Clarke and Barbara Dunham now hope to raise enough to cover the purchase.

headline.main: Model Railroad Builders Win Auction, but Must Raise Money to Pay the Tab
headline.print_headline: At Auction, Model Trains Circle Back to Owners
